p: Interestingly, the present data showed that H 2O 2 induces histopathological changes in the liver, brain and kidney that include dilatation in the central vein, binucleation and inflammation in the liver, congestion in the kidney, and congestion, and hemorrhage in the brain tissue. In the liver, the histopathological changed accompanied by elevation of liver enzymes. The brain is known as the most sensitive organ to oxidative stress because of its high oxygen consumption and low antioxidant content [ 40]. The results are in agreement with a recent study reporting that oxidative stress causes congestion and cerebral hemorrhage [ 41].
